                " event handler, just as for controlled components. However, instead of a "

                "class Form extends React.Component {\n  constructor(props) {\n    super(props);\n    \n    this.onChange = this.onChange.bind(this);\n    \n    this.state = {\n      name: 'John'\n    };\n  }\n  \n  onChange(e) {\n    this.setState({\n      name: e.target.value\n    });\n  }\n  \n  render() {\n    return (\n      <div>\n        <label for='name-input'>Name: </label>\n        <input\n          id='name-input'\n          onChange={this.onChange}\n          defaultValue={this.state.name} />\n      </div>\n    )\n  }\n}"
